article.headline: Alcorn St. 82, Grambling St. 61
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. -- Troy Jackson scored 21 points and Alcorn State defeated Grambling State 82-61 on Monday night. After Grambling State (6-16, 4-7 Southwestern Athletic Conference) took a 34-30 lead with 2:02 left in the first half, Alcorn State (5-19, 3-8) scored seven unanswered points for a 37-34 halftime advantage. In the second half, the Braves used a 20-6 run to take a 57-40 lead with 13:49 left to play on a Jonathan Boyd 3-pointer. Alcorn State shot 57 percent from 3-point range in the second half (8 of 14) with Boyd connecting on four. The closest the Tigers would get the rest of the way was 66-50 with 8:44 left. Antonio Jones, Jarvis Williams and Boyd scored 12 points each for the Braves. Ariece Perkins was Grambling State's leading scorer with 17 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
